posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: In that case, I suggest pure Cleric with 15 STR and 12 INT, lowering DEX to 8 to allow that. The 4 skills you would maximize would be Concentration, Discipline, Spellcraft (to 29), and Tumble (to 30). Boost STR at level 4, and all other boosts go to WIS. Divine Power will (briefly) boost your STR to 18, and then Bull's Strength will boost it further. If you can work Divine Might and/or Divine Shield in there, that would be a bonus. I would make the build for you, but it would actually teach you more if I (and others) describe the build, and you make it.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content: Clerics have to cross-class to get Discipline so a few levels of CoT would be good splash in to top out Discpline.  CoT can get Great Wisdom as bonus feats also.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Oh yeah, and you'll have to cross-class Tumble to 15, not 30, as well. If you go that route, put those 4 CoT levels in epic, and use the feats for Epic Prowess and Armor Skin. Having fewer levels of Cleric does weaken your spell penetration (vs the enemy's Spell Resistance), though. You don't want to take 4 CoT pre-epic because you want to get the 4th attack from Divine Power, not from BAB. If you get the 4th attack from Divine Power, it will be at full AB, but if you get it from BAB, it will be at full AB - 15.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you lower your CHA, you won't be as effective at turning undead, or using Divine Might or Divine shield, if you take those feats. How about you start with 14 in STR and WIS and CON and CHA, and 10 in DEX, and 12 in INT, and then use gifts for +2 WIS and STR, and then boost only WIS as you level up?
